title: NovoCure, Fastenal, FedEx, Johnson & Johnson: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: Futures suggested technology stocks could post gains at the open
body:
Here’s what we’re watching ahead of Tuesday’s opening bell.
— Johnson & Johnson shares dropped 2.1% ahead of the bell. U.S. health authorities recommended pausing the use of its one-shot Covid-19 vaccine to investigate rare but severe cases of blood clots.
—Shares of other vaccine makers gained. Pfizer was up 1%, Moderna jumped 6.9% and Novavax climbed 7%.
— NovoCure shares rocketed 82% higher premarket after the developer of treatments for tumors gave an update on a phase 3 trial of a treatment for non-small cell lung cancer.
— Fastenal shares dropped 2.4% premarket after it released its latest earnings report.
